# âš¡ Quick Setup Guide

**Fast-track guide to get Open Stack JS appearing in GitHub communities!**

## ðŸš€ 5-Minute Setup

### Step 1: Add Topics (2 minutes)

1. Go to: https://github.com/khaleedbinaziz1/open-stack-js/settings
2. Scroll to **Topics** â†’ Click **Edit**
3. Copy and paste this:
   ```
   contributions-welcome, first-timers-only, good-first-issue, help-wanted, open-source, nextjs, typescript, react, fullstack, web-development, learning-platform, education, visual-learning, beginner-friendly, open-source-education
   ```
4. Click **Save**

### Step 2: Create Labels (1 minute)

Go to: https://github.com/khaleedbinaziz1/open-stack-js/labels â†’ Click **New label**

Create these labels:

| Label | Color |
|-------|-------|
| `good first issue` | #0e8a16 (green) |
| `help wanted` | #159818 (blue) |
| `first-timers-only` | #c2e0c6 (light green) |
| `bug` | #d73a4a (red) |
| `enhancement` | #a2eeef (cyan) |
| `documentation` | #0075ca (blue) |

### Step 3: Create First Issue (2 minutes)

Go to: https://github.com/khaleedbinaziz1/open-stack-js/issues/new

**Use the "Good First Issue" template** and fill it out with:

- **Title**: `[Good First Issue] Improve README structure and add table of contents`
- **Labels**: `good first issue`, `help wanted`
- **Description**: 
  ```
  This is a beginner-friendly task to improve the README.
  
  Tasks:
  - Add a table of contents
  - Improve section formatting
  - Add more installation details
  - Fix any typos or grammar issues
  
  Perfect for first-time contributors!
  ```

## âœ… Done!

Your repository should appear on GitHub community pages within 24-48 hours!

## ðŸ“‹ Next Steps (Optional but Recommended)

1. **Create 2-3 more issues** using the templates
2. **Set up Discussions** (Settings â†’ General â†’ Discussions)
3. **Share on social media** to attract contributors
